SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Quickly Identify and Track Your Changed Configuration Settings

Keep your configuration cache history organized by adding a detailed label to each cache entry that you build. That's right—you no longer have to remember which cache entry corresponds to which set of configuration settings. Now, you can add a remark—up to 255 characters— to each cache entry so you can quickly test, revert, or troubleshoot changed settings.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

How: After you upgrade the managed package, the Configuration Cache Management page of CC Admin Global Settings includes a new column, called Label. Click the label text field next to a configuration cache record, and enter a description of the changes you made. Click the checkmark  to save your text as the new label.

SEE ALSO
Build, Activate, or Deactivate a Configuration Cache

title: Quickly Identify and Track Changed Configuration Settings in B2B Commerce for Visualforce
